result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Kenneth M Rosko in court. Attorney Mackenzie Renner for Grace Hagerman in court for Kenneth M Rosko. Victim was also present in court. Attorney Renner motioned the court for bond modification. Arguments presented to the court, denied. Defendant appears for his initial appearance, complaint was given. Defendant waived reading of the complaint, was advised of charges. Not guilty plea entered by counsel. Speedy trial right reserved.  Statement by victim regarding no contact. Defendant a nd victim will need to follow procedure to lift no contact. Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court.  Minutes filed.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

*AMENDED 7-29-22: NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH J.M.A. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. 

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH J.M.A OR RESIDENCE. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Case called at 1:46 PM. Samuel Berg for the State. Attorney Hagerman for defendant. Record by state as to bond. Response by Attorney Hagerman, no objection. Victim is not present. $1000 RoR bond set. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
